Wasn't there a comment made in the origional series that when the skyspy was
launched it either malfunctioned or just mistook the mechanical things as
the dominant lifeforms? if so then if it wouldn't have made the mistake then
they would've been plants, animals, and even people.
----- Original Message -----
From: <Yanshosh@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 05, 2000 9:48 PM
Subject: Re: Maximals


> I don't really like clogging RPG mail with OOC discussions, but I'm gonna
> contribute to this anyways.
>
> As I understand it (unless I've forgotten or had suffered severe brain
> damage), the Ark crashed on past earth (about 3999995 years ago). I don't
> think they went through any transwarp portal or anything, but they wern't
too
> outdated when they emerged 4 mil years later because the war was taking
too
> much of Cybertron's and the Cybertronians' resources and time for them to
> make any technological progress. I think at one point there were only
about
> 100 bots total on Cybertron, and 100 bots whose time is taken up killing
each
> other, wouldn't have too much time to invent new things. The war did,
after
> all, sap all of Cybertron's resources and ended its golden age, so why
> couldn't it stop technological advances as well?
>
> Although I believe that when the Autobots and Decepticons were awakened
> transwarp technology was being developed. I guess that's a step forward.
>
>
> Glad to see you're alive, Firefox!
>
>
> Good night everyone.
>
>
>
